trial_identification.studytitle: Factors associated with postpartum hemorrhage maternal morbidity and mortality in Minia Governorate hospitals
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Factors associated with postpartum hemorrhage maternal morbidity and mortality in Minia Governorate hospitals a cross-sectional epidemiological survey

interventions.interventions: all cases will deliver in Minia govern rate hospitals will be followed up for 24h for development of primary PPH ,, cases have had PPH will be followed up for maternal morbidity and mortality outcomes from onset of bleeding till control of bleeding or death .

primaryOutcome.outcome: Identification of factors which lead to increase PPH associated maternal mortality by review patient history , investigation and events during labor .
primaryOutcome.timepoint: factors identified from start of labor to control of bleeding or death

secondaryOutcome.outcome: factors associated with increase PPH related morbidity by review patient history , investigation and events during labor .
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: factors associated with increase PPH related morbidity by review patient history , investigation and events during labor . Time point from start of labour to control of bleeding or death .

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All women will give birth in Minia governorate hospitals complicated with postpartum hemorrhage in 1st 24hours of labor.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Women with incomplete data collection during labor or postpartum period.

trial_design.statisticalmethods:
Based on previous studies at the same hospital, the incidence of pph was approximately 2.5%. About 10000 women give birth at the hospital every year. So the expected number if cases to be diagnosed with pph during the study period will be 300, Sample size calculation was calculated by EPi Info program depending in the type of the study which was clinical trial. Using proportion of expected outcome among treated group and among control group . Level of statistical significance power used at less than . 0.05. Level of attrition should not exceed 10-15%
the same method was used for calculation of sample size only thing that was changed is the hospital flow per year it was increased this year than it was expected to reach 12000 cases per year .

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Minia university campus , Minia university , Minia . Minia postal code 61519

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Minia university campus , minia university , Minia Minia postal code 61519

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
This cross sectional survey study will be carried out in 12 hospitals in Minia governorate during the period from July 2016 till June 2017 after approval of ethical committee faculty of medicine All cases of postpartum hemorrhage will be observed prospectively Maternal morbidity and mortality related to postpartum hemorrhage will be recorded in all cases give birth in Minia governorate hospitals main objective of the study to identify factors that associated with increased maternal morbidity and mortality in cases that will develope primary PPH,study hypothesis if we can understand these factors that increase maternal complication we can avoid them for better maternal outcome
Detailed data about all cases will be recorded in the form of personal data obstetric data medical data, data related to medical service and hospital characteristics Personal data
Obstetric data Parity Previous mode of delivery Previous history of postpartum hemorrhage Regular antenatal care of current pregnancy Prelabour HB% Birth weight. Medical data who attending delivery 5-Experience of doctor assisting delivery G P or resident or senior resident or specialist or senior specialist or consultant 6-Mangment of third stage :Active or passive 7-Time taken to diagnose postpartum hemorrhage 8-transfer-delivary interval time 9-Hospital referral One or two or managed in same hospital 10-Proceuders done Conservative or Exploration conservative surgery or hysterectomy 11- Hospital will manage postpartum hemorrhage Primary or secondary or tertiary 12-Availability of blood transfusion 13-Number of blood units and blood products units received 14-Type of morbidity Cardiovascular dysfunction Respiratory dysfunction Renal dysfunction. Hepatic dysfunction. Coagulation dysfunction. Neurological dysfunction. Complications of blood transfusion Complications related to fertility 15-I C U admission 16-Maternal mortality related to postpartum hemorrhage objective to assess factors associated with maternal morbidity and mortality in patients with postpartum hemorrhage in Minia governorate hospitals
ethicsAndSummary.publicnotes: This cross sectional survey study will be carried out in 12 hospitals in Minia governorate during the period from July 2016 till June 2017 after approval of ethical committee faculty of medicine All cases of postpartum hemorrhage will be observed prospectively Maternal morbidity and mortality related to postpartum hemorrhage will be recorded in all cases give birth in Minia governorate hospitals Inclusion criteria All women will give birth in Minia governorate hospitals complicated with postpartum hemorrhage in 1st 24hours of labor. Exclusion criteria Women with incomplete data collection during labor or postpartum period Detailed data about all cases will be recorded in the form of personal data obstetric data medical data, data related to medical service and hospital characteristics Personal data Age Residence Rural or urban Residence Near or outside the region location of the hospital Body mass index Level of education Primary or secondary or tertiary Social standard: Low or mid or high Obstetric data Parity Previous mode of delivery Previous history of postpartum hemorrhage Regular antenatal care of current pregnancy Prelabour HB% Birth weight. Medical data Anemia Coagulation defect Diabets. Renal disease. Liver disease. Hypertensive disorders. Cardiac disease Data related to medical service delivered Place of delivery 2-Mode of delivery 3-Time of delivery Day or night 4-Who attending delivery 5-Experience of doctor assisting delivery G P or resident or senior resident or specialist or senior specialist or consultant 6-Mangment of third stage :Active or passive 7-Time taken to diagnose postpartum hemorrhage 8-transfer-delivary interval time 9-Hospital referral One or two or managed in same hospital 10-Proceuders done Conservative or Exploration conservative surgery or hysterectomy 11- Hospital will manage postpartum hemorrhage Primary or secondary or tertiary 12-Availability of blood transfusion 13-Number of blood units and blood products units received 14-Type of morbidity Cardiovascular dysfunction Respiratory dysfunction Renal dysfunction. Hepatic dysfunction. Coagulation dysfunction. Neurological dysfunction. Complications of blood transfusion Complications related to fertility 15-I C U admission 16-Maternal mortality related to postpartum hemorrhage objective to assess factors associated with maternal morbidity and mortality in patients with postpartum hemorrhage in Minia governorate hospitals
